title: Which European countries have universities that are easier to get admitted in for average students (outside from EU)? - Quora

response.answer_text: Have you looked at universities in UK?UK is outside the EU an has many good universities for computer science. I looked at Coursefinder.telegraph.co.uk and filtered by computer science course.  There were many options which I am sure accept average students. Assuming you would need a work visa to work after graduation , you want to think about how immigrant friendly is the work visa policy in UK. Many of my friends fromIndia had to come back home because the work visa policy was not favourable. Please think about that before going ahead with the big step. And finally have you looked at US universities ? There are unlimited opportunities to choose from here. I mStudying at University of Florida and it has a very good computer science programme. Go Gators

Well, there are many countries, which accept same. All they need is student with good intention of studies, and reasonable speaking skills in English. Countries like Portugal, Lithuania, Latvia, Slovakia, Slovenia, Hungary, Italy, Spain are among these. Tuition fees for these ranges between 1500–5000 Euro per year, There is NO IELTS or Toefl requirement. However basic english skills are must. Feel free to ask any specific question.
